verses.kjv: When the morning was come, all the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death:
verses.web: Now when morning had come, all the chief priests and the elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death:
verses.ct: At dawn, all the chief priests and elders of the people met together and made plans to have Jesus put to death.

verses.kjv: And when they had bound him, they led him away, and delivered him to Pontius Pilate the governor.
verses.web: and they bound him, and led him away, and delivered him up to Pontius Pilate, the governor.
verses.ct: They bound him, led him away, and handed him over to Pontius Pilate, the governor.

verses.kjv: Then Judas, which had betrayed him, when he saw that he was condemned, repented himself, and brought again the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,
verses.web: Then Judas, who betrayed him, when he saw that Jesus was condemned, felt remorse, and brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,
verses.ct: When Judas, the one who had betrayed him, saw that Jesus had been condemned, he was overcome with remorse. He took the 30 pieces of silver back to the chief priests and elders.

verses.kjv: Saying, I have sinned in that I have betrayed the innocent blood. And they said, What is that to us? see thou to that.
verses.web: saying, “I have sinned in that I betrayed innocent blood.” But they said, “What is that to us? You see to it.”
verses.ct: "I have sinned," he said. "I betrayed an innocent man." But they replied, "Why should we care? That's your problem."

verses.kjv: And he cast down the pieces of silver in the temple, and departed, and went and hanged himself.
verses.web: He threw down the pieces of silver in the sanctuary, and departed. He went away and hanged himself.
verses.ct: Judas threw the silver coins on the floor of the temple, walked out, and went and hanged himself.

verses.kjv: And the chief priests took the silver pieces, and said, It is not lawful for to put them into the treasury, because it is the price of blood.
verses.web: The chief priests took the pieces of silver, and said, “It’s not lawful to put them into the treasury, since it is the price of blood.”
verses.ct: The chief priests picked up the silver and said, "We can't put this in the temple treasury — it's blood money."

verses.kjv: And they took counsel, and bought with them the potter’s field, to bury strangers in.
verses.web: They took counsel, and bought the potter’s field with them, to bury strangers in.
verses.ct: So after discussing it, they used the money to buy the potter's field as a burial place for foreigners.

verses.kjv: Wherefore that field was called, The field of blood, unto this day.
verses.web: Therefore that field was called “The Field of Blood” to this day.
verses.ct: That's why it's been called "The Field of Blood" ever since.

verses.kjv: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet, saying, And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of him that was valued, whom they of the children of Israel did value;
verses.web: Then that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled, saying, “They took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of him upon whom a price had been set, whom some of the children of Israel priced,
verses.ct: This fulfilled what the prophet Jeremiah had spoken: "They took the 30 pieces of silver — the price set on him by the people of Israel —

verses.kjv: And gave them for the potter’s field, as the Lord appointed me.
verses.web: and they gave them for the potter’s field, as the Lord commanded me.”
verses.ct: and used them to buy the potter's field, just as the Lord directed me."

verses.kjv: And Jesus stood before the governor: and the governor asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And Jesus said unto him, Thou sayest.
verses.web: Now Jesus stood before the governor: and the governor asked him, saying, “Are you the King of the Jews?” Jesus said to him, “So you say.”
verses.ct: Jesus stood before the governor, and Pilate asked him, "Are you the King of the Jews?" Jesus answered, "You have said so."

verses.kjv: And when he was accused of the chief priests and elders, he answered nothing.
verses.web: When he was accused by the chief priests and elders, he answered nothing.
verses.ct: When the chief priests and elders brought their accusations against him, Jesus said nothing.

verses.kjv: Then said Pilate unto him, Hearest thou not how many things they witness against thee?
verses.web: Then Pilate said to him, “Don’t you hear how many things they testify against you?”
verses.ct: Pilate asked him, "Don't you hear all these charges they're making against you?"

verses.kjv: And he answered him to never a word; insomuch that the governor marvelled greatly.
verses.web: He gave him no answer, not even one word, so that the governor marveled greatly.
verses.ct: But Jesus didn't answer — not a single word. The governor was amazed.

verses.kjv: Now at that feast the governor was wont to release unto the people a prisoner, whom they would.
verses.web: Now at the feast the governor was accustomed to release to the multitude one prisoner, whom they desired.
verses.ct: Now it was the governor's custom during the festival to release one prisoner — whichever one the crowd chose.

verses.kjv: And they had then a notable prisoner, called Barabbas.
verses.web: They had then a notable prisoner, called Barabbas.
verses.ct: At that time, they had a notorious prisoner named Barabbas.

verses.kjv: Therefore when they were gathered together, Pilate said unto them, Whom will ye that I release unto you? Barabbas, or Jesus which is called Christ?
verses.web: When therefore they were gathered together, Pilate said to them, “Whom do you want me to release to you? Barabbas, or Jesus, who is called Christ?”
verses.ct: So when the crowd had gathered, Pilate asked them, "Who do you want me to release — Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Christ?"

verses.kjv: For he knew that for envy they had delivered him.
verses.web: For he knew that because of envy they had delivered him up.
verses.ct: He knew perfectly well that they had handed Jesus over out of jealousy.

verses.kjv: When he was set down on the judgment seat, his wife sent unto him, saying, Have thou nothing to do with that just man: for I have suffered many things this day in a dream because of him.
verses.web: While he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent to him, saying, “Have nothing to do with that righteous man, for I have suffered many things today in a dream because of him.”
verses.ct: While Pilate was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent him a message: "Don't have anything to do with that righteous man. I had a terrible dream about him today."

verses.kjv: But the chief priests and elders persuaded the multitude that they should ask Barabbas, and destroy Jesus.
verses.web: Now the chief priests and the elders persuaded the multitudes to ask for Barabbas, and destroy Jesus.
verses.ct: But the chief priests and elders worked the crowd, convincing them to ask for Barabbas and to demand that Jesus be killed.

verses.kjv: The governor answered and said unto them, Whether of the twain will ye that I release unto you? They said, Barabbas.
verses.web: But the governor answered them, “Which of the two do you want me to release to you?” They said, “Barabbas!”
verses.ct: The governor asked again, "Which of the two do you want me to release?" They shouted, "Barabbas!"

verses.kjv: Pilate saith unto them, What shall I do then with Jesus which is called Christ? They all say unto him, Let him be crucified.
verses.web: Pilate said to them, “What then shall I do to Jesus, who is called Christ?” They all said to him, “Let him be crucified!”
verses.ct: Pilate asked, "Then what should I do with Jesus who is called Christ?" They all shouted, "Crucify him!"

verses.kjv: And the governor said, Why, what evil hath he done? But they cried out the more, saying, Let him be crucified.
verses.web: But the governor said, “Why? What evil has he done?” But they cried out exceedingly, saying, “Let him be crucified!”
verses.ct: "Why?" the governor asked. "What crime has he committed?" But they just screamed louder, "Crucify him!"

verses.kjv: When Pilate saw that he could prevail nothing, but that rather a tumult was made, he took water, and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, I am innocent of the blood of this just person: see ye to it.
verses.web: So when Pilate saw that nothing was being gained, but rather that a disturbance was starting, he took water, and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, “I am innocent of the blood of this righteous person. You see to it.”
verses.ct: When Pilate saw that he was getting nowhere and that a riot was about to break out, he took water and washed his hands in front of the crowd. "I am innocent of this righteous man's blood," he said. "This is on you."

verses.kjv: Then answered all the people, and said, His blood be on us, and on our children.
verses.web: All the people answered, “May his blood be on us, and on our children!”
verses.ct: The whole crowd answered, "Let his blood be on us and on our children!"

verses.kjv: Then released he Barabbas unto them: and when he had scourged Jesus, he delivered him to be crucified.
verses.web: Then he released to them Barabbas, but Jesus he flogged and delivered to be crucified.
verses.ct: So Pilate released Barabbas to them. He had Jesus flogged and then handed him over to be crucified.

verses.kjv: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the common hall, and gathered unto him the whole band of soldiers.
verses.web: Then the governor’s soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium, and gathered the whole garrison together against him.
verses.ct: The governor's soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium and assembled the entire garrison around him.

verses.kjv: And they stripped him, and put on him a scarlet robe.
verses.web: They stripped him, and put a scarlet robe on him.
verses.ct: They stripped him and draped a scarlet robe over him.

verses.kjv: And when they had platted a crown of thorns, they put it upon his head, and a reed in his right hand: and they bowed the knee before him, and mocked him, saying, Hail, King of the Jews!
verses.web: They braided a crown of thorns and put it on his head, and a reed in his right hand; and they kneeled down before him, and mocked him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
verses.ct: They twisted together a crown of thorns and shoved it onto his head, then placed a reed in his right hand. They knelt in front of him and mocked him, saying, "Hail, King of the Jews!"

verses.kjv: And they spit upon him, and took the reed, and smote him on the head.
verses.web: They spat on him, and took the reed and struck him on the head.
verses.ct: They spit on him, grabbed the reed, and struck him on the head with it.

verses.kjv: And after that they had mocked him, they took the robe off from him, and put his own raiment on him, and led him away to crucify him.
verses.web: When they had mocked him, they took the robe off him, and put his clothes on him, and led him away to crucify him.
verses.ct: After they finished mocking him, they pulled off the robe, put his own clothes back on him, and led him away to be crucified.

verses.kjv: And as they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name: him they compelled to bear his cross.
verses.web: As they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name, and they compelled him to go with them, that he might carry his cross.
verses.ct: On the way out, they grabbed a man from Cyrene named Simon and forced him to carry Jesus' cross.

verses.kjv: And when they were come unto a place called Golgotha, that is to say, a place of a skull,
verses.web: When they came to a place called “Golgotha”, that is to say, “The place of a skull,”
verses.ct: They arrived at a place called Golgotha, which means "The Place of the Skull."

verses.kjv: They gave him vinegar to drink mingled with gall: and when he had tasted thereof, he would not drink.
verses.web: they gave him sour wine to drink mixed with gall. When he had tasted it, he would not drink.
verses.ct: There they offered him wine mixed with gall to drink, but after tasting it, he refused it.

verses.kjv: And they crucified him, and parted his garments, casting lots: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, They parted my garments among them, and upon my vesture did they cast lots.
verses.web: When they had crucified him, they divided his clothing among them, casting lots,
verses.ct: They crucified him and divided up his clothes by casting lots, fulfilling what the prophet had said: "They divided my garments among them and cast lots for my clothing."

verses.kjv: And sitting down they watched him there;
verses.web: and they sat and watched him there.
verses.ct: Then they sat down and kept watch over him.

verses.kjv: And set up over his head his accusation written, THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
verses.web: They set up over his head the accusation against him written, “THIS IS JESUS, THE KING OF THE JEWS.”
verses.ct: Above his head they posted the charge against him: THIS IS JESUS, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

verses.kjv: Then were there two thieves crucified with him, one on the right hand, and another on the left.
verses.web: Then there were two robbers crucified with him, one on his right hand and one on the left.
verses.ct: Two thieves were crucified alongside him, one on his right and one on his left.

verses.kjv: And they that passed by reviled him, wagging their heads,
verses.web: Those who passed by blasphemed him, wagging their heads,
verses.ct: People passing by hurled insults at him, shaking their heads

verses.kjv: And saying, Thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest it in three days, save thyself. If thou be the Son of God, come down from the cross.
verses.web: and saying, “You who destroy the temple, and build it in three days, save yourself! If you are the Son of God, come down from the cross!”
verses.ct: and saying, "You who were going to destroy the temple and rebuild it in 3 days — save yourself! If you're the Son of God, come down from the cross!"

verses.kjv: Likewise also the chief priests mocking him, with the scribes and elders, said,
verses.web: Likewise the chief priests also mocking, with the scribes, the Pharisees, and the elders, said,
verses.ct: The chief priests, along with the scribes and elders, mocked him the same way.

verses.kjv: He saved others; himself he cannot save. If he be the King of Israel, let him now come down from the cross, and we will believe him.
verses.web: “He saved others, but he can’t save himself. If he is the King of Israel, let him come down from the cross now, and we will believe in him.
verses.ct: "He saved others," they said, "but he can't save himself! If he's the King of Israel, let him come down from the cross right now, and we'll believe in him."

verses.kjv: He trusted in God; let him deliver him now, if he will have him: for he said, I am the Son of God.
verses.web: He trusts in God. Let God deliver him now, if he wants him; for he said, ‘I am the Son of God.’ ”
verses.ct: "He trusts in God — let God rescue him now, if God even wants him! After all, he claimed, 'I am the Son of God.'"

verses.kjv: The thieves also, which were crucified with him, cast the same in his teeth.
verses.web: The robbers also who were crucified with him cast on him the same reproach.
verses.ct: Even the thieves crucified beside him threw the same insults at him.

verses.kjv: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land unto the ninth hour.
verses.web: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land until the ninth hour.
verses.ct: From noon until 3 in the afternoon, darkness covered the entire land.

verses.kjv: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani? that is to say, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?
verses.web: About the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, “Eli, Eli, lima sabachthani?” That is, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”
verses.ct: Around 3 in the afternoon, Jesus cried out in a loud voice, "Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?" — which means, "My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?"

verses.kjv: Some of them that stood there, when they heard that, said, This man calleth for Elias.
verses.web: Some of them who stood there, when they heard it, said, “This man is calling Elijah.”
verses.ct: Some of the people standing nearby heard this and said, "He's calling for Elijah."

verses.kjv: And straightway one of them ran, and took a spunge, and filled it with vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him to drink.
verses.web: Immediately one of them ran, and took a sponge, and filled it with vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him a drink.
verses.ct: Immediately one of them ran and grabbed a sponge, soaked it in sour wine, stuck it on a reed, and held it up for him to drink.

verses.kjv: The rest said, Let be, let us see whether Elias will come to save him.
verses.web: The rest said, “Let him be. Let’s see whether Elijah comes to save him.”
verses.ct: But the others said, "Leave him alone. Let's see if Elijah comes to save him."

verses.kjv: Jesus, when he had cried again with a loud voice, yielded up the ghost.
verses.web: Jesus cried again with a loud voice, and yielded up his spirit.
verses.ct: Jesus cried out once more in a loud voice and breathed his last.

verses.kjv: And, behold, the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom; and the earth did quake, and the rocks rent;
verses.web: Behold, the veil of the temple was torn in two from the top to the bottom. The earth quaked and the rocks were split.
verses.ct: At that moment, the curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom. The earth shook and rocks split apart.

verses.kjv: And the graves were opened; and many bodies of the saints which slept arose,
verses.web: The tombs were opened, and many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised;
verses.ct: Tombs broke open, and the bodies of many holy people who had died were raised to life.

verses.kjv: And came out of the graves after his resurrection, and went into the holy city, and appeared unto many.
verses.web: and coming out of the tombs after his resurrection, they entered into the holy city and appeared to many.
verses.ct: After Jesus' resurrection, they came out of the tombs, went into the holy city, and appeared to many people.

verses.kjv: Now when the centurion, and they that were with him, watching Jesus, saw the earthquake, and those things that were done, they feared greatly, saying, Truly this was the Son of God.
verses.web: Now the centurion, and those who were with him watching Jesus, when they saw the earthquake, and the things that were done, feared exceedingly, saying, “Truly this was the Son of God.”
verses.ct: When the centurion and the soldiers guarding Jesus saw the earthquake and everything that happened, they were terrified and said, "This truly was the Son of God."

verses.kjv: And many women were there beholding afar off, which followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering unto him:
verses.web: Many women were there watching from afar, who had followed Jesus from Galilee, serving him.
verses.ct: Many women who had followed Jesus from Galilee and cared for his needs were watching from a distance.

verses.kjv: Among which was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of Zebedee’s children.
verses.web: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.
verses.ct: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of Zebedee's sons.

verses.kjv: When the even was come, there came a rich man of Arimathaea, named Joseph, who also himself was Jesus’ disciple:
verses.web: When evening had come, a rich man from Arimathaea, named Joseph, who himself was also Jesus’ disciple came.
verses.ct: That evening, a wealthy man from Arimathaea named Joseph arrived. He was a disciple of Jesus.

verses.kjv: He went to Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered.
verses.web: This man went to Pilate, and asked for Jesus’ body. Then Pilate commanded the body to be given up.
verses.ct: He went to Pilate and asked for Jesus' body. Pilate ordered that it be given to him.

verses.kjv: And when Joseph had taken the body, he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
verses.web: Joseph took the body, and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
verses.ct: Joseph took the body and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth.

verses.kjv: And laid it in his own new tomb, which he had hewn out in the rock: and he rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulchre, and departed.
verses.web: and laid it in his own new tomb, which he had cut out in the rock, and he rolled a great stone against the door of the tomb, and departed.
verses.ct: He placed it in his own new tomb, which had been carved out of rock. Then he rolled a large stone across the entrance and left.

verses.kjv: And there was Mary Magdalene, and the other Mary, sitting over against the sepulchre.
verses.web: Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, sitting opposite the tomb.
verses.ct: Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were sitting there across from the tomb.

verses.kjv: Now the next day, that followed the day of the preparation, the chief priests and Pharisees came together unto Pilate,
verses.web: Now on the next day, which was the day after the Preparation Day, the chief priests and the Pharisees were gathered together to Pilate,
verses.ct: The next day — the day after Preparation Day — the chief priests and Pharisees went together to Pilate.

verses.kjv: Saying, Sir, we remember that that deceiver said, while he was yet alive, After three days I will rise again.
verses.web: saying, “Sir, we remember what that deceiver said while he was still alive: ‘After three days I will rise again.’
verses.ct: "Sir," they said, "we remember that while he was still alive, that deceiver claimed, 'After 3 days I will rise again.'

verses.kjv: Command therefore that the sepulchre be made sure until the third day, lest his disciples come by night, and steal him away, and say unto the people, He is risen from the dead: so the last error shall be worse than the first.
verses.web: Command therefore that the tomb be made secure until the third day, lest perhaps his disciples come at night and steal him away, and tell the people, ‘He is risen from the dead;’ and the last deception will be worse than the first.”
verses.ct: So give the order to secure the tomb until the 3rd day. Otherwise, his disciples might come at night, steal the body, and tell the people, 'He has risen from the dead.' That deception would be even worse than the first."

verses.kjv: Pilate said unto them, Ye have a watch: go your way, make it as sure as ye can.
verses.web: Pilate said to them, “You have a guard. Go, make it as secure as you can.”
verses.ct: Pilate told them, "You have a guard. Go and make the tomb as secure as you can."

verses.kjv: So they went, and made the sepulchre sure, sealing the stone, and setting a watch.
verses.web: So they went with the guard and made the tomb secure, sealing the stone.
verses.ct: So they went, sealed the stone, and posted the guard to secure the tomb.
